    <a id="main-content"></a>
            		<h1 class="title" id="page-title">Our Engineering Tech Blog Blasts Off</h1>
                        <div class="block block-system block-main block-system-main odd block-without-title" id="block-system-main">
  <div class="block-inner clearfix">
                
    <div class="content clearfix">
      


<article about="/articles/20150817/1697/our-engineering-tech-blog-blasts" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="node node-article node-published node-not-promoted node-not-sticky author-tsigmund odd clearfix" id="node-article-1697">
        <span property="dc:title" content="Our Engineering Tech Blog Blasts Off" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span><span property="sioc:num_replies" content="0" datatype="xsd:integer" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>	  
    
    <div class="post-date">Posted on 08-18-15</div>		
		<div class="share-bar">
			<a class="print_ico" href="/print/articles/20150817/1697/our-engineering-tech-blog-blasts">Print</a>
			<!-- <a class="pdf_ico" href="/printpdf/articles/20150817/1697/our-engineering-tech-blog-blasts">PDF</a> -->
			<span class='st_email_custom st_ico' displayText='Email'></span>
			<span class='st_twitter_custom st_ico' displayText='Tweet'></span>
			<span class='st_facebook_custom st_ico' displayText='Facebook'></span>
			<span class='st_linkedin_custom st_ico' displayText='LinkedIn'></span>
			<span class='st_google_custom st_ico' displayText='Google'></span>
			<script type="text/javascript">var switchTo5x=true;</script>
			<script type="text/javascript" src="http://w.sharethis.com/button/buttons.js"></script>
			<script type="text/javascript">
				stLight.options({
		        publisher: 'f65a6e51-8a93-4acd-a665-976809c16a17',
		        onhover: false
		    });</script>
		</div>

    
  
  <div class="content clearfix">
    <div class="field field-name-field-main-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.riotgames.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_image/public/content/article/images/main/techblogheader2.png?itok=-NaecDdv" width="700" height="300" alt="" /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"> <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-d441cf30-3e43-33c9-2e03-85eed0acec05">After weeks of crafting and tinkering, today&rsquo;s a happy day for Riot engineers! The weather is perfect, they&rsquo;ve attached the clamps and flipped the switch, and now the <a href="http://engineering.riotgames.com/" target="_blank">Engineering tech blog</a> is alive&hellip; IT&rsquo;S ALIVE!!</span></p>
<p class="rtecenter"><span><img alt="" src="/sites/default/files/Alive.gif" style="width: 450px; height: 252px;" /></span></p>
<p dir="ltr"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d441cf30-3e43-5e88-fa41-371258da9594">Our engineers touch nearly every part of the company, helping to solve problems big and small. The tech blog&rsquo;s a chance to open up about the work they do. You can expect articles and videos chockful of guides and learnings that Heimer&rsquo;d be proud of. With the blog, we want to start conversations with you and learn from comments and questions.</span></p>
<p dir="ltr"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d441cf30-3e43-5e88-fa41-371258da9594">The tech blog launches with five pieces, including <a href="http://engineering.riotgames.com/news/riot-games-engineering-techblog" target="_blank">an introduction</a> from VP of engineering Scott Gelb. If you&rsquo;ve had a chance to check out our merch store, you might dig Jason Rose&rsquo;s presentation on <a href="http://engineering.riotgames.com/news/building-merchandise-store-riot-games" target="_blank">scaling website architecture</a>. Michal Ptaszek kicks off a series on </span><em>LoL&rsquo;s </em>chat services, first <a href="http://engineering.riotgames.com/news/chat-service-architecture-protocol" target="_blank">talking about XMPP</a>, which we use for client/server communications. Brian Bosse shares how a <a href="http://engineering.riotgames.com/news/behind-leagues-new-missile-system" target="_blank">cleaned up missile system</a> allows engineers to jazz up projectiles to whatever their troubled minds can muster. And last but not least, Jaewon Jung discusses how we&rsquo;re <a href="http://engineering.riotgames.com/news/compressing-skeletal-animation-data" target="_blank">compressing animation data</a> to buff performance and prevent toaster implosion.</p>
<p dir="ltr"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d441cf30-3e43-5e88-fa41-371258da9594">We have plans to share a wide range of engineering topics in future weeks, and we hope you&rsquo;ll jump into the conversation. If you dig what we&rsquo;re working on and think it&rsquo;d be your kind of gig, head over to </span><a href="http://www.riotgames.com/careers" target="_blank">Riot Careers</a> to see our open positions.&nbsp;</p>
 </div></div></div>
        
    <span class="print-link"></span><div class="field-group-format group_tags field-group-div group-tags clearfix speed-none effect-none"><h3><span>Tags:</span></h3><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/engineering" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel">Engineering</a></div></div></div></div>  </div>
  
  <div class="clearfix">
          <nav class="links node-links clearfix"></nav>
    
		<a href="/news" class="view-all">All Articles</a>
      </div>
</article>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>      </div>

sejam maiores que um smartphone.</p></div></a><!--!--></div></div></div><div class="post-aggregateds"></div></div></div><div class="bastian-feed-item" data-index="9"><div><div class="feed-post     }

      padding: 3px 13px;
    }

    #catalogo-pagina .header-navegacao.header-g1 .floating-bar .header-title .header-editoria--link {
      padding: 4px 0;
    }

        width: 32px;

      }

        padding: 0 74px;

        font-size: 28px;
      }

    @media (min-width: 1065px) {
      .header-navegacao .header-title {
        padding: 0 145px;  
      }

        display: none;

<div class="nwl-wrapper">
<ul class="nwl-news-of-day" id="articles">
<script id="articles-template" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
          {{#each articles}}            

            <li id="nativeads_position_{{@index}}" class="{{#not_empty cover_image_url}}nwl-has-img{{/not_empty}} nwl-row {{#if showDate}}new-date{{/if}}">     

              {{#if showDate}}
                <h6 class="nwl-date"> {{dateFormat first_published_at}} </h6>
              {{/if}}
              <div class="clearfix"></div>
              <div class="wrap-li">
                <span class="nwl-news-time">{{timeFormat first_published_at}}</span>

                {{#not_empty cover_image_url}}
                <span data-href="{{url}}" title="{{treatment_title title}}" class="nwl-wpr-cover box">
                  <div class="r7-shareit-holder">                      
                      <div class="image-holder" style="position: relative">
                      <img alt="" class="article-video-icon-tag" style="{{#not_empty is_video}}display: block{{/not_empty}}" src="data:image/png;base64," />

                        <a href="{{url}}" title="{{treatment_title title}}" data-social-headline="{{section_name}}"  data-social-lead="{{treatment_title title}}" data-shorten="{{url}}" target="{{is_r7_domain url}}">
                            <img class="nwl-cover-reference" src="{{treatment_image cover_image_url}}" title="{{treatment_title title}}" width="180" height="95" />
                        </a>
                            <div class="r7-shareit-bar no-text">
        <ul class="r7-shareit small">
          <li data-social-type="facebook" title="Compartilhe no Facebook" class="r7-icons r7-facebook shareit"></li>
          <li data-social-type="twitter" title="Compartilhe no Twitter" class="r7-icons r7-twitter shareit"></li>
          <li data-social-type="gPlus" title="Compartilhe no Google Plus" class="r7-icons r7-gPlus shareit"></li>
          <li data-social-type="pinterest" title="Compartilhe no Pinterest" class="r7-icons r7-pinterest shareit"></li>
        </ul>
    </div>

                      </div>                      
                  </div>
                </span>
                {{/not_empty}}

                <div class="nwl-info">
                  <div class="r7-shareit-holder">
                    <p class="nwl-news-title">
                      <a href="{{section_url}}" class="nwl-section nw-link bullet content_scheme" target="{{is_r7_domain section_url}}">{{section_name}}</a>
                    </p>
                    <p class="nwl-news-title link-holder">
                      <a data-social-headline="{{section_name}}"  data-social-lead="{{treatment_title title}}" data-shorten="{{url}}" href="{{url}}" title="{{treatment_title title}}" class="nwl-link" target="{{is_r7_domain url}}">
                        {{treatment_title title}}
                      </a>
                      <img class="hidden" src="{{cover_image_url}}" />

                    <div class="r7-social-media-bar">
                      <ul class="r7-social-media mini" data-shorten="{{url}}" data-image="{{cover_image_url}}" data-lead="{{treatment_title title}}" data-headline="{{section_name}}">
                        <li class="r7-share r7-icons r7-facebook shareit" data-social-type="facebook" title="Compartilhe no Facebook">
                          Compartilhe no Facebook
                        </li>
                        <li class="r7-share r7-icons r7-twitter shareit" data-social-type="twitter" title="Compartilhe no Twitter">
                          Compartilhe no Twitter
                        </li>
                        <li class="r7-share r7-icons r7-gPlus shareit" data-social-type="gPlus" title="Compartilhe no Google Plus">
                          Compartilhe no Google Plus
                        </li>
                      </ul>
                    </div>

                    </p>
                  </div>
                </div>

              </div>
            </li>
          {{/each}}
        </script>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

                </p><ul class="menu-root menu-level mosaic-states-list"><li class="menu-item is-father"><a href="/pr/parana/" class="menu-item-link state parana" title="paraná" data-submenu-id="list-subregions-parana"><span class="menu-item-title" data-submenu-id="list-subregions-parana">
                                        paraná

                  media="screen"
                  href="//s.glbimg.com/gl/ba/css/barra-globocom.min.css"
                  type="text/css"/><script type="text/javascript">(function(){glb.barra={exibeAssineJa:true,exibeCentral:true,iframe:false};var s=document.createElement("script");s.type="text/javascript";s.async=true;s.charset="utf-8";s.src="//s.glbimg.com/gl/ba/js/barra-globocom.min.js";var ss=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];ss.parentNode.insertBefore(s,ss);})();</script><script type="text/javascript">
(function() {
    'use strict';

    var timerId ; // Current timer handler
    var refreshTime = 300000; // 1000*60*5
    var graceTimerStep = 10000; // 1000*10

    var isMobile = function() {
        return ($('#regua-navegacao:visible').length > 0);
    };

    var preparePlayer = function(player) {

        var refreshPageWithTimeout = function() {

            console.log('Trying to refresh on' + graceTimerStep + ' ms.');
            setTimeout(function() {
                    if (!player.isPlaying()) {
                        refreshPage();
                    }
                    console.log('Watching a video. Refresh the page later');
                }, graceTimerStep);
        };

        var playerComplete = player.complete;
        if ($.isFunction(playerComplete)) {
            player.complete = function() {
                playerComplete.apply(this, arguments);
                refreshPage();
            };
        }
        else {
            player.complete = refreshPage;
        }

        var playerOnPause = player.onPause;
        if ($.isFunction(playerOnPause)) {
            player.onPause = function() {
                playerOnPause.apply(this, arguments);
                refreshPageWithTimeout(player);
            };
        }
        else {
            player.onPause = refreshPageWithTimeout;
        }

        var playerOnStop = player.onStop;
        if ($.isFunction(playerOnStop)) {
            player.onStop = function() {
              playerOnStop.apply(this, arguments);
              refreshPageWithTimeout();
          };
        }
        else {
            player.onStop = refreshPageWithTimeout;
        }
    };

    var refreshPage = function() {
        if (!isMobile()) {
            console.log('Refreshing now');
            window.location.reload();
        }
        else {
            console.log('Is mobile: Not reloading the page.');
        }
    };

    var checkForVideoPlaying = function() {

        console.log('Timeout: Refreshing the page at any moment.');

        clearTimeout(timerId); // clear timer

        var isVideoPlaying = false;

        $.each(WM.PlayerManager, function(index, player) {
            isVideoPlaying = isVideoPlaying || player.isPlaying();
            if (player.isPlaying()) {
                preparePlayer(player);
            }
        });

        if (!isVideoPlaying) {
            refreshPage();
        }

    };

    var startTimer = function() {
        timerId = setTimeout(checkForVideoPlaying, refreshTime);
    };

    $(document).ready(function() {
        if (!isMobile() && window.location.hash != '#debug' ) {
            console.log('Time Started: ' + refreshTime + ' ms until Refresh.');
            startTimer();
        }
    });

})();
</script></body><!-- Página gerada em 25/03/2017 19:59:00 --></html>

    <a id="main-content"></a>
            		<h1 class="title" id="page-title">Riot Games Los Angeles</h1>
                        <div class="block block-system block-main block-system-main odd block-without-title" id="block-system-main">
  <div class="block-inner clearfix">
                
    <div class="content clearfix">
      


<article about="/articles/20150904/233/riot-games-los-angeles" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="node node-article node-published node-not-promoted node-not-sticky author-bsnyder odd clearfix" id="node-article-233">
        <span property="dc:title" content="Riot Games Los Angeles" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span><span property="sioc:num_replies" content="0" datatype="xsd:integer" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>	  
    
    <div class="post-date">Posted on 06-15-11</div>		
		<div class="share-bar">
			<a class="print_ico" href="/print/articles/20150904/233/riot-games-los-angeles">Print</a>
			<!-- <a class="pdf_ico" href="/printpdf/articles/20150904/233/riot-games-los-angeles">PDF</a> -->
			<span class='st_email_custom st_ico' displayText='Email'></span>
			<span class='st_twitter_custom st_ico' displayText='Tweet'></span>
			<span class='st_facebook_custom st_ico' displayText='Facebook'></span>
			<span class='st_linkedin_custom st_ico' displayText='LinkedIn'></span>
			<span class='st_google_custom st_ico' displayText='Google'></span>
			<script type="text/javascript">var switchTo5x=true;</script>
			<script type="text/javascript" src="http://w.sharethis.com/button/buttons.js"></script>
			<script type="text/javascript">
				stLight.options({
		        publisher: 'f65a6e51-8a93-4acd-a665-976809c16a17',
		        onhover: false
		    });</script>
		</div>

    
  
  <div class="content clearfix">
    <div class="field field-name-field-main-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.riotgames.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_image/public/content/article/images/main/Annie%20and%20Tibbers%20statue70.jpg?itok=l2dIBVzY" width="700" height="299" alt="" /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"> <p dir="ltr"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d8523468-1209-29c4-f464-85da7d62e893">Our <a href="http://www.riotgames.com/articles/20150420/1663/twas-night-our-move-la" target="_blank">new space</a> in West Los Angeles is home to central teams ranging from Design, Publishing and Engineering to Art, Esports, and Player Support. It&rsquo;s where we develop </span><em>League of Legends </em>and play support to local regional teams.</p>
<p dir="ltr"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d8523468-1209-29c4-f464-85da7d62e893">Rioters in L.A. collaborate in customized workspaces and head outside for new perspectives in our greenscaped quad. We also glean inspiration from our surroundings: cozy conference rooms where we create and debate, Bilgewater Brew where the </span><em>League </em>universe comes to life, and places to play like the PC Bang, arcade, and outside basketball court.</p>
<p dir="ltr"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d8523468-1209-29c4-f464-85da7d62e893">We carved out this campus in L.A., a city exploding with culture - from Van Goghs at LACMA to the Banksy on the corner of Compton and E. Washington. It&rsquo;s a city full of smart, creative people making cool shit faster than a Hadron Collider that&rsquo;s been chugging energy drinks all day. We think you&rsquo;ll prolly like it, too.</span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="rtecenter"><a class="intern-btn" href="http://www.riotgames.com/careers/?offices=884&amp;depts=" target="_blank"><span>Check out Open Jobs</span></a></p>
<h3>
	<span>Pics from LA:</span></h3>
 </div></div></div>

<article about="/articles/20091022/259/league-legends-pre-season-begins-after-beta" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="node node-article node-teaser node-published node-not-promoted node-not-sticky author-mmccurley odd clearfix" id="node-article-259">
        <header>
    <h2 class="node-title"><a href="/articles/20091022/259/league-legends-pre-season-begins-after-beta" title="League of Legends preseason begins after beta">League of Legends preseason begins after beta</a></h2>
  </header>
    <span property="dc:title" content="League of Legends preseason begins after beta" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span><span property="sioc:num_replies" content="0" datatype="xsd:integer" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
    
  
  <div class="content clearfix">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Get an early jump on <em>League of Legends</em>! You're invited to sign up for the beta before the pre-season begins on October 22, 2009. Each <em>League of Legends</em> season will start with a...</p></div></div></div>  </div>
  
  <div class="clearfix">
          <nav class="links node-links clearfix"><ul class="links inline"><li class="node-readmore first last"><a href="/articles/20091022/259/league-legends-pre-season-begins-after-beta" rel="tag" title="League of Legends preseason begins after beta">Read more<span class="element-invisible"> about League of Legends preseason begins after beta</span></a></li></ul></nav>
    
      </div>
</article>


<article about="/articles/20091007/260/league-legends-here" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="node node-article node-teaser node-published node-not-promoted node-not-sticky author-mmccurley even clearfix" id="node-article-260">
        <header>
    <h2 class="node-title"><a href="/articles/20091007/260/league-legends-here" title="League of Legends launches!">League of Legends launches!</a></h2>
  </header>
    <span property="dc:title" content="League of Legends launches!" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span><span property="sioc:num_replies" content="0" datatype="xsd:integer" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
    
  
  <div class="content clearfix">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><em>League of Legends </em>is live! Featuring 40 playable champions, two unique maps, and 5v5 matchmaking, <em>League of Legends</em> is team-based PVP at its most competitive. Brave the dangers of Summoner's Rift and...</p></div></div></div>  </div>
  
  <div class="clearfix">
          <nav class="links node-links clearfix"><ul class="links inline"><li class="node-readmore first last"><a href="/articles/20091007/260/league-legends-here" rel="tag" title="League of Legends launches!">Read more<span class="element-invisible"> about League of Legends launches!</span></a></li></ul></nav>
    
      </div>
</article>


<article about="/articles/20090602/240/league-legends-launches-fall-2009" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="node node-article node-teaser node-published node-not-promoted node-not-sticky author-mmccurley odd clearfix" id="node-article-240">
        <header>
    <h2 class="node-title"><a href="/articles/20090602/240/league-legends-launches-fall-2009" title="League of Legends launches Fall 2009">League of Legends launches Fall 2009</a></h2>
  </header>
    <span property="dc:title" content="League of Legends launches Fall 2009" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span><span property="sioc:num_replies" content="0" datatype="xsd:integer" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>
    
  
  <div class="content clearfix">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Riot Games announced that <em>League of Legends</em> will launch in the fall. Players can <a href="https://signup.leagueoflegends.com/" target="_blank">download and play</a> for free at <a href="https://www.leagueoflegends.com" target="_blank">www.leagueoflegends.com</a>.</p> <p><a href="/sites/default/files/uploads/090602_NEWS_lol_lollaunchsept.pdf" target="_blank">Click for PDF press release</a>....</p></div></div></div>  </div>
  
  <div class="clearfix">
          <nav class="links node-links clearfix"><ul class="links inline"><li class="node-readmore first last"><a href="/articles/20090602/240/league-legends-launches-fall-2009" rel="tag" title="League of Legends launches Fall 2009">Read more<span class="element-invisible"> about League of Legends launches Fall 2009</span></a></li></ul></nav>
    
      </div>
</article>

			<article id="home-intro" class="span5 pull-right panel has-header">
				<header class="panel-header wh-80 bl-txt">
					<div class="top"></div>
					<h2 class="panel-title">Take your vision to the next level of success</h2>
				</header>
				<div class="content gr-65 wh-txt">
					<p>Element:LA is a 12-acre creative campus, centrally located in West Los Angeles.</p>
				</div>
			</article>
			
		</div>
			
			<div class="row">
			<div class="panel-wrap right-notch span4">
				<div class="top"></div>
				<div class="panel">
					<div class="content">
						 <p><a href="#construction" role="button" class="btn" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#construction" title="Launch video">Watch Element:LA come together &raquo;</a></p>
						<!-- Modal -->
						<div id="construction" class="modal hide fade" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-labelledby="myModalLabel" aria-hidden="true">

							</video>

type="text/javascript">window.NREUM||(NREUM={});NREUM.info={"beacon":"bam.nr-data.net","queueTime":0,"licenseKey":"fdf153714a","agent":"","transactionName":"blMDZkdWXEBXUkxZDlcZJ0dbVEZaWV8XUwxKGBdbUEBBHUZQX1VbWlsSbUVWVVY=","applicationID":"39108861","errorBeacon":"bam.nr-data.net","applicationTime":64}</script>

  <!-- Page -->
  
  <div class="page animsition">
    <div class="page-content padding-30-main container-fluid">
      

<div class="row">
	<div class="col-md-10 panel-content">
		<div class="span12">
        <center><h4>"Submit a piece of software that utilizes game data<br>from the Ultra Rapid Fire game mode."</h4></center>
        <br><br>
        <h2>First Place</h2>
        <div style="display: inline-block; width: 100%">
            <div>
                <img src="https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/riot-api/api-challenge/2015/urfplaystyles.png" align="right" style="width: 300px; height: 225px; margin-left: 10px;">
                <h4 style="margin-bottom: 0;"><a href="https://github.com/microtony/microtony-urf" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">URF Play Styles</a> <span style="color: #555; font-size: 21px;"><b>By microtony (NA)</b></span></h4>
                As you might imagine, we received more than a couple entries that were focused on providing stats focused around URF mode. URF Play Styles took URF stats even further by comparing the differences between URF games and Normal games. Perhaps the most impressive aspect of URF Play Styles was how the developer decided to determined the roles of champions in the URF meta. URF mode is unlike any other mode in League of Legends and required a new approach. URF Play Styles used machine learning to determine roles by the items that the champion purchased. You can read more about how the developer accomplished this on the site’s <a href="http://urf.microtony.com/#/about" target="_blank">About</a> page.
            </div>
        </div>
        <br><br>
        <h2>Runners-up</h2>
        <div style="display: inline-block; width: 100%">
            <div style="height: 250px">
                <img src="https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/riot-api/api-challenge/2015/summonurfsrift.png" align="left" style="width: 300px; height: 225px; margin-right: 10px;">
                <h4 style="margin-bottom: 0;"><a href="https://github.com/red3141/UrfChallenge2015" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Summonurf's Rift</a> <span style="color: #555; font-size: 21px;"><b>By RndmInternetMan (NA) and KirkBerkley (NA)</b></span></h4>
                The developers of Summonurf’s Rift decided to utilize URF data to create an experience that might only be possible with data gathered from URF mode. In a unique and creative twist, Summonurf’s Rift is a game where the player is thrown into a gauntlet of “abilities” that represent kills and assists in a real URF game. Because the game is created through a systematic generation of obstacles based on events in the game this experience can be recreated and shared amongst friends which is why we chose Summonurf’s Rift as one of the runner-up entries in the API Challenge. Here are some of our favorites that we’ve affectionately titled <a href="http://red3141.github.io/UrfChallenge2015/?matchId=1788377376" target="_blank">Udyr Pls</a> and <a href="http://red3141.github.io/UrfChallenge2015/?matchId=1788237827" target="_blank">Lux OP</a>
            </div>
            <div style="height: 250px">
                <img src="https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/riot-api/api-challenge/2015/whosthatchampion.png" align="left" style="width: 300px; height: 225px; margin-right: 10px;">
                <h4 style="margin-bottom: 0;"><a href="https://github.com/rithms/whos-that-champion" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Who's that Champion?</a> <span style="color: #555; font-size: 21px;"><b>By Rithms (NA)</b></span></h4>
                Lastly but by no means the least, we chose Who’s That Champion as a runner-up because it creatively capitalized on the unconventional style of URF mode. This game presents players with an item build and the order in which skills were leveled for an champion in a specific game. It’s the player’s job to try and determine which champion in the game matched these clues. Because it was URF mode, champions were often built and leveled in ways that no one could have expected. We found this game to be extremely engaging in a group and we admittedly spent a good chunk of time playing Who’s That Champion, as pods of Rioters lost many an hour clustered around a monitor enthusiastically arguing what to pick. "Just one more..." was said more than a few times!
            </div>
        </div>
        <h2>Honorable Mentions</h2>
        There are entries which catch our eye because of their unique execution in a particular aspect of the competition. Here are some of those entries:<br><br>
        <div style="display: inline-block; width: 100%">
            <div>
                <h4 style="margin-bottom: 0;"><a href="https://github.com/201AnitaRoad/URF-API-Challenge" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Sjokz to the System</a> <span style="color: #555; font-size: 21px;"><b>By Ultra Deluxe (NA) and dajuicebaby (NA)</b></span></h4>
                This submission included a paper about the volatility of the League of Legends meta-game and used the Riot Games API to back up its hypothesis.
            </div>
            <br>
            <div>
                <h4 style="margin-bottom: 0;"><a href="https://github.com/tercenya/invalesco" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Invalesco</a> <span style="color: #555; font-size: 21px;"><b>By Arinya (NA)</b></span></h4>
                This submission, also a paper, dove into probabilistic analysis and simulation in order to form a predictive model for determining the outcome of a game before it begins.
            </div>
            <br>
            <div>
                <h4 style="margin-bottom: 0;"><a href="https://github.com/josephyi/urfantasy" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">For What It's URF</a> <span style="color: #555; font-size: 21px;"><b>By orlyzomg (NA) and dbanksdesign (NA)</b></span></h4>
                When building a project that other people can use, documentation is as important as code. This submission caught our eye because of its detailed documentation describing the dependencies, installation, and setup.
            </div>
        </div>
        <br><br><br>
        <h2>Comprehensive List of Entries</h2>
        <a href="https://github.com/adamgede/gentlemen-game" target="_blank">A Gentleman's Game</a> by AdamGede (NA) and Lillian09 (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/CrackdGaming/LoLApiChallenge" target="_blank">A Puma in the jungle</a> by A Puma (NA) and lolboxen (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/andy135/URinFo" target="_blank">Andiag URFinFo</a> by Greenstorm21 (EUW) and Brrokken Iago (EUW)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/dalisaydavid/AziReport" target="_blank">AziReport</a> by ddayknight (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/desmond-silveira/banindex" target="_blank">Ban Index</a> by dhalsim2 (NA) and TustinFocus (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/viral69/fritosapi" target="_blank">Book of the DoubleSwords</a> by Locksign (NA) and Forsakenwarder63 (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/Turlmeh/Buffed-or-NURFd" target="_blank">Buffed or NURF'd?</a> by Turtleman65 (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/RpprRoger/lolapichallenge" target="_blank">Cards of Legends</a> by RpprRoger (EUW) and WWWWWWWWWWWWWWV (EUW)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/dennistu1994/api_challenge" target="_blank">Champion Statistics - URF 2015</a> by DennisWasTaken (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/LLIuqppuH/CreepyScore" target="_blank">CreepyScore site</a> by Tango Evelynn (RU)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/lakederek88/Data-of-Legends-Repo" target="_blank">Data of Legends</a> by Urfrider Teemo (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/TwelveNights/Death-by-the-Second" target="_blank">Death by the Second</a> by JackelPPA (NA) and Jamalrus (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/OddNaughty/lol-api-challenge" target="_blank">Esport42 - Who's the best farmer</a> by OdNaughty (EUW) and I Teteaclake I (EUW)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/niraj-rayalla/Face-Check" target="_blank">Face Check</a> by Lazerdawg07 (NA) and hindupower (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/bgodbgg/fantasynurf" target="_blank">Fantasy NURF</a> by bgodbgg (NA) and SuperJMop (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/Xero-Vortex/flash-replay" target="_blank">Flash Replay</a> by Xero Vortex (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/josephyi/urfantasy" target="_blank">For What It's URF</a> by orlyzomg (NA) and dbanksdesign (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/stango12/freechamprotation" target="_blank">Free Champion Rotation</a> by stango (NA)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/AmShaegar13/gambling_legend" target="_blank">Gambling Legend</a> by AmShaegar (EUW) and Freigeist (EUW)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/Jack3113/GentleManatee" target="_blank">GentleManatee</a> by HackJack (EUW) and Aamu Lumi (EUW)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/geftimov/android-league" target="_blank">Georgi Eftimov</a> by JokataVR (EUNE)<br>
        <a href="https://github.com/kevinnoll/heimerdinger" target="_blank">Heimerdinger</a> by IAmTheCount (EUW) and derpson (EUW)<br>

  <!-- Page -->
  
  <div class="page animsition">
    <div class="page-content padding-30-main container-fluid">
      

<div class="row">
	<div class="col-md-10 panel-content">
		<div class="span9">
        <h2>API Keys</h2>

        <p>
            Anyone who signs into the developer portal will automatically be granted an API key associated with their account. If you haven't yet done so, please visit the <a href="/getting-started.html">Getting Started</a> page for more information. Your API key allows you to start using the API, and allows us to generate API usage metrics for your key.
        </p>

        <div style="height:15px;"></div>
        <h4>Development and Interim API Keys</h4>

        <p>
            The API key that was generated for you when you signed into the developer portal is a development API key. Interim API keys are temporarily granted for projects that are not meant for public consumption but do require temporary access to the API. The purpose of a development or interim API key is for you to tinker with the Riot Games API and potentially develop a prototype for a project that you can make available for the community to use.
        </p>

        <p>
            Other acceptable uses for a development API key include:
            </p><ul>
                <li>bots for streaming sites, boards, voice com servers, etc.</li>
                <li>to display your own personal stats for your personal website</li>
                <li>personal projects to gather your own stats</li>
                <li>personal research</li>
                <li>projects meant for personal usage and not production</li>
            </ul>
        <p></p>

        <p>
            The rate limit for development keys is by design very limited:
            </p><ul>
                <li>10 requests every 10 seconds</li>
                <li>500 requests every 10 minutes</li>
            </ul>
            Note that rate limits are enforced per region. For example, with the above rate limit, you could make 10 requests every 10 seconds to both NA and EUW endpoints simultaneously.
        <p></p>

        <p>
            You can find your development API key and its rate limit on <a href="/">your dashboard</a>.  In addition, the metrics we generate for your key allow you to track your key's usage under the <b>Development API Key Usage</b> section on your dashboard. Note that these graphs will include all calls made with your API key, even those that don't count against your rate limit (e.g., calls to the static data API). For more information on rate limits, see the
        <a href="/rate-limiting.html">Rate Limiting</a> documentation.
        </p>

        <div style="height:15px;"></div>
        <h4>Production API Keys</h4>

        <p>
            If you have developed an application that you would like to open up to use by the community, you should apply for a production API key. You should not try to maintain a public application or website off of a development API key. Production API keys have a much higher rate limit suitable for sustaining a production application's traffic.
        </p>

        <p>
            The standard rate limit of a production API key is much larger than the development key:
            </p><ul>
                <li>3,000 requests every 10 seconds</li>
                <li>180,000 requests every 10 minutes</li>
            </ul>
            Remember that this rate limit is enforced per region.
        <p></p>

        <p>
            To apply for a production key with an expanded rate limit, click on the "Register Project" button on your dashboard, then fill out and submit the form. The process and length of time required to obtain an approved production key can vary depending on your project and the application's target region(s). It's best to apply for a production API key as soon as you have a functional application, so we can get a better idea of what you're working on and facilitate a speedy application process. For more information on policies and process, see the <a href="/policies.html#generalpolicies">General Policies</a> and <a href="/application-process.html">Application Process</a> documentation.
        </p>

        <p>
            Note that the standard production rate limit will meet the needs of the large majority of developers but it can be expanded if the developer is in good standing, has demonstrated a strong community benefit, and has steadily outgrown the standard production limit.
        </p>

        <p>
            If you are working on multiple projects, you should register each one separately and each one needs to be individually approved for a separate production API key.
        </p>

        <p>
            Production API keys are only granted to projects that are available, visible, and usable by the community and comply with our <a href="/policies.html#generalpolicies">General Policies</a>.
        </p>

        <p>
            If you have an approved production application, you can click on that application from your dashboard to view the application details page, which will display the rate limit for that application's key. In addition, the metrics we generate for your key allow you to track your key's usage under the <b>API Key Usage</b> section on the application details page. Note that these graphs will include all calls made with your API key, even those that don't count against your rate limit (e.g., calls to the static data API). For more information on rate limits, see the
        <a href="/rate-limiting.html">Rate Limiting</a> documentation.
        </p>

        <div style="height:15px;"></div>
        <h4>Security</h4>

        <p>
            It's important to mention that any key may be revoked if it isn't being properly secured. Securing your API key is a requirement to publishing an project as outlined in the <a href="/policies.html#generalpolicies">General Policies</a>.
            For more information on securing your API key, please see the <a href="/policies.html#credentialsecurity">Credentials Security</a> page.</p>
    </div>
	</div>
</div>


    </div>
  </div>

o=n[t]={exports:{}};e[t][0].call(o.exports,function(n){var o=e[t][1][n];return r(o||n)},o,o.exports)}return n[t].exports}if("function"==typeof __nr_require)return __nr_require;for(var 	<li class="list-group-item list-group-item-api list-group-item--bold list-group-messages">
        <a href='#tournament-provider-v1' class="api_option" api-name="tournament-provider-v1">tournament-provider-v1<span class="api_desc">Tournaments API</span></a>
    </li>

        </div>
    </div>

<!-- Side Nav Bar -->
	<div class="site-menubar">
		<div class="nav-side">
			<div class="scrollable-container">
				<ul class="app-nav-bar" id="side-bar">
          			
          				<li class="list-group-item list-group-item--bold list-group-messages sidebar_items"><a id='link_generalpolicies' href='#generalpolicies'>General Policies</a></li>
					
          				<li class="list-group-item list-group-item--bold list-group-messages sidebar_items"><a id='link_tournamentpolicies' href='#tournamentpolicies'>Tournament Policies</a></li>
					
          				<li class="list-group-item list-group-item--bold list-group-messages sidebar_items"><a id='link_credentialsecurity' href='#credentialsecurity'>Credential Security</a></li>
					
          				<li class="list-group-item list-group-item--bold list-group-messages sidebar_items"><a id='link_monetization' href='#monetization'>Monetization</a></li>
					
          				<li class="list-group-item list-group-item--bold list-group-messages sidebar_items"><a id='link_bestpractices' href='#bestpractices'>Best Practices</a></li>

	<!-- Content -->
	<div class="main-view">
    <div class="padding-left-350">
    	<div class="padding-top-10">
      	<div class="terms">
          <div class="row" style="margin-bottom:20px;">
					
						<div id="generalpolicies" class="module-pages-padding">
							<div id="general_policies" class="span12 module-pages-padding target" style="padding-top: 70px; margin-top: -70px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif;"><h2 style="font-family: &quot;Beaufort for LOL&quot;, serif; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(117, 117, 117); margin-top: 22px; margin-bottom: 11px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; font-size: 25px !important;">GENERAL POLICIES</h2><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase;">READ THESE THOROUGHLY</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Our goal is to provide developers with a set of tools to create projects that will create a better player experience. We try as much as possible to not guide or hinder the creative process. While we remain as hands off as possible we do, at times, need to step in to ensure projects don’t have a negative impact to players. That being the case, we care about the developer community as well as the players they develop projects for, so if you have questions let us know as soon as possible and we’ll be happy to provide guidance. Please note, by following these guidelines and eventually getting your application approved, it means we’ve approved your application for a production API key. We don’t give individual projects a stamp of approval, but rather ensure they don’t conflict with our player-focused policies.</p><br><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">When working with the Riot Games API and other Developer Tools, we have several conditions set forth in our&nbsp;<a href="/terms-and-conditions.html" target="_blank" style="color: rgb(220, 41, 30);">Terms of Use</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.riotgames.com/legal-jibber-jabber" target="_blank" style="color: rgb(220, 41, 30);">Legal Jibber Jabber</a>. We know that can be a pretty dense read, so here’s a quick synopsis of some of the key points that come up most often. (Note however this is&nbsp;NOT&nbsp;all inclusive and that you still need to read and agree to the Terms)<br><br>The goal is to enrich the League of Legends community and provide a better player experience. If your project may lead to a negative player experience please talk to us before it’s too late! There are some things that we're flexible on, but there are also some things we take a hard stance on.</p><br><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(61, 65, 69); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase;">PLEASE DON'T</h4><ul style="margin-bottom: 20px;"><li>Break the law</li><li>Publish a project that doesn't properly secure your API key</li><li>Utilize a Development or Interim API key to run a publicly accessible production project (Development and Interim API keys are to be used to create a prototype that we can review before the project is made available for public consumption)</li><li>Compromise the integrity of the game or create an unfair advantage for players</li><li>Charge money for your app or provide exclusive access, in whole or in part, to specific users</li><li>Provide alternate channels to report or evaluate other players</li><li>Create alternatives for official skill ranking systems, such as Ranked Leagues (Prohibited alternatives include MMR or ELO calculators)</li><li>Refer to your project to be in a partnership or approved by Riot Games</li><li>Utilize methods to connect to other League of Legends systems, such as League chat, that haven't been included in the third party tools. (Except where otherwise noted in any official exceptions, if any.)</li><li>Scrape data from undocumented endpoints or any other sources outside of the provided Riot API Endpoints and other documented Third Party Developer Tools. (Except where otherwise noted in any official exceptions, if any.)</li><li>Build or design any tools or components designed to look like the native League of Legends or Riot Games branding and designs, both in-game and out.</li></ul><p style="margin-bottom: 20px;">If you have an idea that you think might fall within a gray area feel free ask us in your project's application. Make sure to include a description and the goal behind your project, and then post your question as an App Note within the application. We’ll be happy to provide you with feedback and work with you to achieve your goal without conflicting with policies we have in place to protect the player experience.</p><br><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(61, 65, 69); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase;">PLEASE DO</h4><ul style="margin-bottom: 20px;"><li>Think outside the box</li><li>Think of ways for players to evaluate and improve their own gameplay</li><li>Think of ways to connect players with their friends</li><li>Blow our minds (it’s encouraged)</li><li>Feel free to use any of our art assets from the game (but&nbsp;NOT&nbsp;any official Logos)</li></ul><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">As mentioned, this is not an all-inclusive list, so please be sure to read through all of the&nbsp;<a a="" href="/terms-and-conditions.html" target="_blank" style="color: rgb(220, 41, 30);">Terms of Use</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.riotgames.com/legal-jibber-jabber" target="_blank" style="color: rgb(220, 41, 30);">Legal Jibber Jabber</a>&nbsp;as well!</p></div><div id="tournament" class="span12 module-pages-padding target" style="padding-top: 70px; margin-top: -70px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"></div>
							<hr>
						</div>
						
						<div id="tournamentpolicies" class="module-pages-padding">
							<div id="tournament" class="span12 module-pages-padding target" style="padding-top: 70px; margin-top: -70px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"><h2 style="font-family: &quot;Beaufort for LOL&quot;, serif; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(117, 117, 117); margin-top: 22px; margin-bottom: 11px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; font-size: 25px !important;">TOURNAMENT POLICIES</h2><ol style="margin-bottom: 20px;"><li>You are responsible to ensure a fair and balanced system for matchmaking teams.</li><li>All features of your project must be freely available to every tournament participant.</li><li>A tournament must have a minimum of 20 active participants, regardless of team size (1v1, 3v3, 5v5 etc).</li><li>Teams must progress through the tournament by playing directly against their opponents. It must be a traditional style tournament (elimination, round robin, etc) and not direct challenges or ladder systems.</li><li>Anything related to wagering, betting, gambling, or any other use of real money outside of a nominal entry fee is not permitted. No exceptions.</li><li>Custom currencies with a monetary value are strictly forbidden. Entry fees or buy-ins must be displayed in a fiat currency, to provide clarity to the participants, and then distributed amongst the winning teams at the end of the tournament based on placements.<br><br>A&nbsp;<i>fiat currency</i>&nbsp;is a currency backed by a government regulation or law.</li></ol><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Any time money gets involved we take things very seriously. We've seen a considerable amount of shady behavior with regard to the Tournaments API and as such this is not an area we're likely to be understanding. We understand the overwhelming benefit that community tournaments have created for players, but any deviation from these policies is likely to be handled strictly. If you have any questions ask before implementing a feature that may conflict with these policies.</p></div>
							<hr>
						</div>
						
						<div id="credentialsecurity" class="module-pages-padding">
							<div id="credential" class="span10 module-pages-padding target" style="padding-top: 70px; margin-top: -70px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"><h2 style="font-family: &quot;Beaufort for LOL&quot;, serif; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(117, 117, 117); margin-top: 22px; margin-bottom: 11px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; font-size: 25px !important;">CREDENTIAL SECURITY</h2><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Remember, don't share your account information with anyone, including your API key!</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">For your login credentials, take the same precautions as you would with your League of Legends account.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Regarding your API key, this key is tied to your League of Legends account and will be used for your application. If someone has access to your key, they can potentially use it for their own purposes, leaving you without one or with a severely diminished rate limit – even entering your key into another application can be dangerous! You should also make sure that you are using SSL/HTTPS when accessing the APIs so that your key is kept safe. You don’t want anyone else consuming your traffic and making it impossible for you to build your app. Protect your key so that everyone can see the awesome things you build!</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Note that embedding a key in a distributed client application, like a desktop or mobile application, means that your key can be compromised. Even secure storage or encrypted keys on a client can be breached. The only way to ensure your API key remains safe is to have the client application access your own server, which then makes the appropriate request to the API using HTTPS. Even in the worst case scenario, if someone does manage to get your key from your server, through a man-in-the-middle or other type of attack, you can easily regenerate your key and update it in your server. If you have a key distributed across numerous client applications, you won't be able to do that without breaking all of the clients.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">For similar reasons, generally you should not commit your API key to your code base, especially if you plan on building a distributed binary from that code base. Even if your code base is for a server application, we recommend reading your API key from a configuration file running on the server, rather than committing it to the code base. This practice limits your exposure to only the boxes that the server is running on, allows you to easily swap out keys without having to rebuild and redeploy, and prevents accidental sharing of your keys if you ever open source or otherwise share parts of your code.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Note that for teams working together on an application, there will be an obvious need to share an API key for your application. Our intention is not to discourage sharing along these lines, but rather sharing with people outside of your organization or who are working on other projects.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px;">Sometimes people post their API keys on the forums when they are asking for help or giving code examples. Please note that if you do this, we will edit the post to remove the key and then regenerate your key on your account.</p></div>
							<hr>
						</div>
						
						<div id="monetization" class="module-pages-padding">
							<h2 style="font-family: &quot;Beaufort for LOL&quot;, serif; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(117, 117, 117); margin-top: 22px; margin-bottom: 11px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246); font-size: 25px !important;">MONETIZATION POLICIES</h2><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">As you might expect, any time money gets involved we take things very seriously. In any case where you're unsure about whether or not you're breaking our monetization policy you should default to excluding the feature in question. The Riot Games API is provided as a tool for community creators to create a project that can be freely enjoyed by players, it is not meant as a means to generate revenue. We will always put the player's interests first and if we feel a project is taking advantage of players we'll move swiftly to have it removed.<br><br>With that said, we are always looking for ways to support content creators who work on projects that benefit the community, and we know it’s difficult to run these sometimes costly projects. We also understand that developers want to recoup the time and engery it takes to build and maintain these projects. As such there are a few methods which allow developers to offset those costs, which we're fine with.<br><br>We specifically reserve the right to require any form of monetization be removed if we see something sketchy.</p><p><br style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"></p><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">ADVERTISEMENTS</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">We're fine with projects passively collecting revenue from users via advertisements. From our perspective this is the preferred method of monetization to offset the cost of developer's projects.</p><p><br style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"></p><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">PAID REMOVAL OF ADVERTISEMENTS</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">We know it's sometimes difficult to create a tasteful, unobtrusive native experience with advertisements. This is part of the reason why the mobile industry has gravitated toward the paid removal of ads. As such, after contacting us first, we'll allow developers to support their projects with the paid removal of advertisements.<br><br>Developers who are granted permission to monetize their applications will be required to provide the same functionality and experience in their projects with and without advertisements. For mobile and desktop applications, the removal of advertisements is an action that needs to be executed within the application itself. We will not be allowing two separate versions of the application. The app itself must be free, with the option to remove advertisements as an in-app purchase.<br><br>In order to offer the paid removal of advertisements you must:</p><ol style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"><li>Contact us via an App Note within your project's application</li><li>Provide us with a visualization of your project with and without advertisements</li><li>Accept the additional monetization terms within your project's application</li></ol><p><span style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">Projects that offer the paid removal of advertisements without contacting us first will be in violation of our policies and risk having their API key disabled.</span><br></p>
							<hr>
						</div>
						
						<div id="bestpractices" class="module-pages-padding">
							<h2 style="font-family: &quot;Beaufort for LOL&quot;, serif; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(117, 117, 117); margin-top: 22px; margin-bottom: 11px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246); font-size: 25px !important;">BEST PRACTICES</h2><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">DEVELOPMENT KEY</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">The most basic key that every developer receives upon successful registration is limited to 10 requests every 10 seconds. Use this key to discover what the Riot Games API has to offer, form ideas, and test the water.</p><p><span style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">Remember to keep your API key private. This key is tied to your League of Legends account and will be used for your applications. If someone gains access to your key, they can potentially use it for their own purposes, leaving you without one or with a severely diminished rate limit – even entering your key into another application can be dangerous! We don’t want anyone else consuming your traffic and making it impossible for you to build your app, so protect your key and make awesome.</span></p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">We don’t expect your awesome creation to survive in the wild with this key. Once your app or website is ready for players to experience, please register it for us to review. We’ll provide you with a key that can handle “the friendly Reddit DDoS.”</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"><em>Pro tip</em>: Architect your code to accommodate for a key with a variable limit.</p><div style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246); height: 25px;"></div><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">RATE LIMITING</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">Every website and app that consumes data from the Riot Games API has a rate limit. That is, each key may only make a certain number of requests each second. Unaccounted for, your website or app could reach this limit, which may negatively impact player experience.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">For instance, the following pseudocode asynchronously requests the recent games for a large number of players:</p><pre class="prettyprint" style="padding: 10.5px; line-height: 1.57143; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-color: rgb(236, 245, 252); border-radius: 3px;">foreach (summonerId in playersToFetch)
    RiotGamesAPI.recentGamesAsync(summonerId)
</pre><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">This loop could send out thousands of requests in milliseconds. Once the rate limit has been reached for that specific second, the API will return the HTTP response status code “429 Too Many Requests.”</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">The updated pseudocode will sleep for 1 second after making the exact number of requests that the rate limit permits:</p><pre class="prettyprint" style="padding: 10.5px; line-height: 1.57143; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-color: rgb(236, 245, 252); border-radius: 3px;">foreach (summonerId in playersToFetch)
    RiotGamesAPI.recentGamesAsync(summonerId)
    if (requestCount == RATE_LIMIT)
        sleep(1000)
</pre><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"><em>Pro tip</em>: Degrade gracefully. If you hit the limit during a player’s request, give them a friendly error message.</p><div style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246); height: 25px;"></div><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">CACHING</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">Even though the Riot Games API was engineered with speed in mind, we strongly advise against relying on it as your sole data store. Instead, implement a caching layer. By caching every API request, you will decrease response times as well as the total number of requests made.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);"><em>Pro tip</em>: Cache frequently accessed data in memory (Redis, Memcached, etc.) and rarely accessed data on disk (MySQL, RDS, etc.).</p><div style="color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246); height: 25px;"></div><h4 style="font-family: Spiegel-Bold; line-height: 1.2; color: rgb(55, 71, 79); margin-top: 11px; margin-bottom: 11px; font-size: 16px; text-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.14902) 0px 0px 1px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">SUMMONER NAME ENCODING</h4><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">If your website or app takes a summoner name as input, please HTML encode it before making the initial request. Many languages have built in support for HTML encoding, and for those that don’t, external libraries should be available.</p><p style="margin-bottom: 11px; color: rgb(20, 20, 20); font-family: Spiegel-Regular, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(246, 246, 246);">Keywords to search for include “HTML encoding,” “URI escaping,” and “HTML entities.”</p><p style="margin-bott
